intro: Stylogyne darienensis, commonly known as the Darien stylogyne, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in clusters. Its leaves are ovate and have a rough texture, while its stems are woody and often branched. Stylogyne darienensis is adapted to humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
